subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: In the historical Chinese dictionary {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} (<small>{{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}</small>), the character is found written similar to its Japanese form which contains {{l|mul|⿱[[爫]][[𠙻]]}}.

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[𦆸]], [[𨘺]], [[𦾾]]}} ''(Only for mainland China characters as Taiwan characters contain <font lang="zh-tw" size=3>䍃</font> instead)''
* {{l|mul|[[𤁠]], [[𩆡]]}} ''(Vietnamese characters containing {{l|mul|⿱[[爫]][[缶]]}})''
* {{l|mul|[[𨗽]]}} ''(Based on Japanese form containing {{l|mul|⿱[[爫]][[𠙻]]}} as found in historical <small>{{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}</small>)''
